pullRequest.body:
Drop `[Small.{v} R]` assumption from `Module.Flat.iff_*` lemmas [Module.Flat.iff_rTensor_preserves_injective_linearMap](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Flat/Basic.html#Module.Flat.iff_rTensor_preserves_injective_linearMap), [Module.Flat.iff_lTensor_exact](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Flat/Basic.html#Module.Flat.iff_lTensor_exact), and so on.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [911ce5eb8b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17484/commits/911ce5eb8baacff22c640e66151de4c2eb9e1254)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ equiv_iff`
`+ iff_lTensor_exact'`
`+ iff_lTensor_preserves_injective_linearMap'`
`+ iff_rTensor_exact'`
`+ iff_rTensor_preserves_injective_linearMap'`
`+ instance (priority := 100) of_shrink [Small.{v'} M] [Module.Flat R (Shrink.{v'} M)] :`
`+ instance (priority := 100) of_ulift [Module.Flat R (ULift.{v'} M)] : Module.Flat R M`
`+ shrink`
`+ ulift`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5e501328-46c4-4188-8522-f90c33e6b802) for commit d2b10e6dbebe9e9ab04090fcd8a12633e8d6e398.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5e501328-46c4-4188-8522-f90c33e6b802) for commit d2b10e6dbebe9e9ab04090fcd8a12633e8d6e398.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/3c3c79a4-194c-49c1-bae0-11092e7c7c33) for commit 10019ff642cd816809a71e41cd3b5cc29fc7a9ba.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

Should we swap the theorem names of `iff_rTensor_exact` and `iff_rTensor_exact'`? Although `iff_rTensor_exact` (the `[Small.{v'} R]` version) is more general, `iff_rTensor_exact'` (the `Type (max u v)` version) is likely to be more practical.

> Should we swap the theorem names of `iff_rTensor_exact` and `iff_rTensor_exact'`? Although `iff_rTensor_exact` (the `[Small.{v'} R]` version) is more general, `iff_rTensor_exact'` (the `Type (max u v)` version) is likely to be more practical.

I think I like `iff_rTensor_exact` (unprimed version) to be the version without universe levels, but others might disagree

> > Should we swap the theorem names of `iff_rTensor_exact` and `iff_rTensor_exact'`? Although `iff_rTensor_exact` (the `[Small.{v'} R]` version) is more general, `iff_rTensor_exact'` (the `Type (max u v)` version) is likely to be more practical.
> 
> I think I like `iff_rTensor_exact` (unprimed version) to be the version without universe levels, but others might disagree

I'm a little confused about what you mean by “without universe levels”. Do you mean the `N N' N'' : Type` version?

> > > Should we swap the theorem names of `iff_rTensor_exact` and `iff_rTensor_exact'`? Although `iff_rTensor_exact` (the `[Small.{v'} R]` version) is more general, `iff_rTensor_exact'` (the `Type (max u v)` version) is likely to be more practical.
> > 
> > 
> > I think I like `iff_rTensor_exact` (unprimed version) to be the version without universe levels, but others might disagree
> 
> I'm a little confused about what you mean by “without universe levels”. Do you mean the `N N' N'' : Type` version?

Sorry my bad, i meant that the unprimed version to be the one without the `Small` assumptions.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ca90b223-58ae-449e-a7ca-5939514e839e) for commit a0bf4fc04f85540e4a3ceb6a41440d9e6ca37d49.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f9fa4d69-9ce2-4071-82b3-e5cf30b3ab59/to/ca90b223-58ae-449e-a7ca-5939514e839e) against commit c35f067077ad7e27b7545e804de9ec7f477aa938:
```diff
  Benchmark                        Metric         Change
  ======================================================
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Basic   instructions   -22.0%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ca90b223-58ae-449e-a7ca-5939514e839e) for commit a0bf4fc04f85540e4a3ceb6a41440d9e6ca37d49.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f9fa4d69-9ce2-4071-82b3-e5cf30b3ab59/to/ca90b223-58ae-449e-a7ca-5939514e839e) against commit c35f067077ad7e27b7545e804de9ec7f477aa938:
```diff
  Benchmark                        Metric         Change
  ======================================================
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Basic   instructions   -22.0%
```

Thanks!

There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f9fa4d69-9ce2-4071-82b3-e5cf30b3ab59/to/032ee594-6192-417d-8ff1-cf13f0af900a) against commit c35f067077ad7e27b7545e804de9ec7f477aa938:

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a266037a-7d5f-4321-b86c-5ae3468747b4) for commit d8a91816e74b3dde3cde7633f3146c295f9b7a59.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/f9fa4d69-9ce2-4071-82b3-e5cf30b3ab59/to/a266037a-7d5f-4321-b86c-5ae3468747b4) against commit c35f067077ad7e27b7545e804de9ec7f477aa938:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11369328584/job/31626498160)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11369328584/job/31626498968)
maybe `universe u v v' w` makes more sense
I put `v'` at the first since I want it to be the first universe specified in the theorem. This might make it easier to use, similar to `[Small.{v} R]`. Is there a better way to do this?
This makes sense!
a more canonical naming is perhaps `Module.Flat.congr`
Is it possible to drop the `[Small.{v'} R]` and `[Small.{v'} M]` by changing `N N' N'' : Type max u v`
Can you check if similar theorems have this name?

I have found theorems [Module.Finite.equiv_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Finiteness.html#Module.Finite.equiv_iff) and [Algebra.FiniteType.equiv](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/FiniteType.html#Algebra.FiniteType.equiv), so maybe this lemma should be called `Module.Flat.equiv_iff`?
I agree.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Flat/Basic): drop `[Small.{v} R]` assumption in `Module.Flat.iff_*` lemmas
